text: Lj in all letter case forms LJ Lj lj Lj (all uppercase: LJ, all lowercase: lj) is a letter in some Slavic languages. It is a digraph made of the Latin letters L and J. Lj is used for the sound /ʎ/, a sound similar to /lj/ and /lʲ/. It is the 17th letter of Gaj's Latin alphabet (a Latin version of the Serbian Cyrillic alphabet), coming after L and before M. In Unicode, Lj is its own character, with three forms: * * * ==Related pages== *Љ Category:Latin alphabet
title: Lj
